Name: Goddess with leonine head
Description: The lion played an important role in the imagination of the Egyptians from earliest times. Fear and awe of the animal demon influenced the contact between humans and this animal. It is remarkable that the most imposing lion deities are female. This example is a statuette of a standing lion goddess. She is wearing a close-fitting dress and on her head above the mane is a sun disc with uraeus. The legs are slightly striding. Arms and hands are held alongside the body.
